articles.title: About this site
articles.contents:
I am a second-year PhD student in statistics at UC Irvine. I previously received a B.S. in Mathematics-Computer Science at UC San Diego in 2019.
I can be reached at ewongtoi[at]uci[dot]edu.

articles.title: Eliot Wong-Toi
articles.description: Welcome to my website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents:
I am a second-year PhD student in statistics at UC Irvine. I previously received a B.S. in Mathematics-Computer Science at UC San Diego in 2019.
I can be reached at ewongtoi[at]uci[dot]edu.

articles.title: Miscellaneous Projects
articles.description: Other projects I have worked on.
articles.contents:
Projects
Fuel Efficiency
Analysis on a small data set comparing the fuel efficiency of SP98 and E10 fuel.
Coronavirus Reproduction Number
Class project with Isaac Goldstein estimating the reproduction number for coronavirus in Hubei province fit to data from early 2020. We applied the technique of linear noise approximation to data from early 2020 and fit a susceptible-infectious-recovered (SIR) model.

articles.title: Research
articles.description: Some additional details about my research experience and interests.
articles.contents:
UC Irvine
Sports Analytics
Analyzing NBA shot chart data with Professor Weining Shen and Professor Guangyu Hu to cluster players based on offensive contributions.

Micro-Randomized Trials with Binary Outcomes
Co-wrote mrtbincalc package (to be posted on CRAN) and Shiny app for power and sample size calculations for micro-randomized trials with binary outcomes. The formula that is implemented in this package and shiny app is developed in “Sample Size Considerations for Micro-Randomized Trials with Binary Outcome” which is currently a work in progress.

Radiomics
Worked with Professor Michele Guindani in collaboration with UC Davis scientists on analyzing radiomic data for predicting skin cancer. Performed variable selection and fit logistic regression models to provide quantitative reasons for examining certain traits in imaging data.

UC San Diego
Medical Imaging
Implemented convolutional neural network for lung segmentation in MRI images in the UCSD Pulmonary Imaging Lab under the direction fo Professor Rui Carlos Pereira de Sa.
